content.prompt: Which of the following statements is best supported by the data in the table above?

choices.label: Latinos are fairly homogeneous in their party identification.
Latinos have become substantially more supportive of the Democratic Party than they were in the 1950s.
The majority of Latinos probably voted for Bill Clinton in 1992.
Latinos of Cuban descent are more supportive of the Republican Party than are Latinos of Mexican or Puerto Rican descent.
Latinos of Mexican descent are less likely to consider themselves independent than are Latinos of Cuban or Puerto Rican descent.

topic.text: 5.4: How and Why Political Parties Change and Adapt

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
